description: The Burkinabe government has ordered the closing of pre-schools, primary, post-primary and secondary, vocational and university educational establishments from March 16 March 31 throughout the national territory.
type: Closure and Regulation of Schools
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)

description: The Burkinabe government has ordered the closing of pre-schools, primary, post-primary and secondary, vocational and university educational establishments from March 16 March 31 throughout the national territory.
type: Closure and Regulation of Schools
type_sub_cat: Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)

description: The extension by two weeks of the closure of pre-school, primary, post-primary, secondary, vocational and university educational establishments throughout the national territory. The resumption date is set for 14 April 2020, but could be adjusted according to the evolution of the epidemic.
type: Closure and Regulation of Schools
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)

description: The extension by two weeks of the closure of pre-school, primary, post-primary, secondary, vocational and university educational establishments throughout the national territory. type: Closure and Regulation of Schools

description: In terms of freedoms, the Burkinabe government has implemented the establishment of a curfew from 7:00 pm to 5:00 am throughout the nation, starting at midnight on March 21, 2020.
type: Curfew
type_sub_cat: NA

description: The Burkinabe Council declared a state of health alert in accordance with Article 66 of the Public Health Code.
type: Declaration of Emergency
type_sub_cat: NA
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Military,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: The Burkinabe president announced the closure of the Ouagadougou and Bob-Dioulasso airports to commercial flight for a period of 2 weeks, renewable, from March 21 at midnight; this measure does not apply to domestic and military flights and cargo.
type: External Border Restrictions
type_sub_cat: Visa extensions (e.g. visa validity extended)
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: The Burkinabe government announced the closure of all land and rail borders, for a period of two weeks, renewable, starting at midnight on 21 March 2020, except for freight.
type: External Border Restrictions
type_sub_cat: Visa extensions (e.g. visa validity extended)
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Burkina Faso's Ministry of Industry, Trade and Handicrafts has set maximum prices for hydroalcoholic gels and solutions and respiratory protection masks in Burkina Faso, to be fixed for a period of 6 months from March 25, 2020.
type: Health Resources
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Burkinabe Ministry in charge of Research announced on March 26, the launch of two clinical trials of Chloroquine-Azitromycin and Apivirine, a drug produced in Benin and used in the treatment of HIV-AIDS, will also be tested.
type: Health Testing
type_sub_cat: NA
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The wearing of masks or nose-masks will be mandatory from 27 April 2020, throughout the national territory in Burkina Faso.
type: Hygiene
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Military,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: Burkina Faso is suspending urban and interurban public transport of passengers or travellers throughout the national territory, in effect since March 23.
type: Internal Border Restrictions
type_sub_cat: NA
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Burkina Faso's government issued a decree to lockdown for a period of 2 weeks, starting from March 27, 2020 at 7 a.m., all cities or localities having registered a positive case of COVID-19.
type: Lockdown
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country
target_city: Ouagadougou; Bobo-dioulasso; Boromo; Dédougou; Houndé; Banfora; Manga; Zorgho
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description: The city of Dano (Burkina Faso) is placed under lockdown after confirmation of a case of COVID-19.

target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country

description: The Burkinabe Department of Justice announced the suspension of visits to inmates but has authorized the presence of their lawyers from March 19, 2020, until further notice.
